title: Fix tmux orchestrator spawn pattern: exec zsh + unset CLAUDECODE sequence
description:
tmux sessions default to bash, but ccorch is a zsh function. The current system3-orchestrator SKILL.md spawn sequence is missing the critical `exec zsh` step, causing consistent spawn failures.

The correct pattern is:
1. tmux new-session -d -s orch-{name}
2. tmux send-keys 'cd /path/to/worktree' Enter
3. tmux send-keys 'exec zsh' Enter  (CRITICAL - tmux defaults to bash)
4. sleep 2  (wait for zsh to initialize)
5. tmux send-keys 'unset CLAUDECODE' Enter  (prevents nested session error)
6. Set env vars (CLAUDE_SESSION_DIR, CLAUDE_SESSION_ID, CLAUDE_CODE_TASK_LIST_ID, CLAUDE_CODE_EXPERIMENTAL_AGENT_TEAMS)
7. tmux send-keys 'ccorch' Enter
8. sleep 8  (wait for Claude Code init)
9. tmux send-keys '/output-style orchestrator' Enter
10. tmux send-keys 'Read the file at /tmp/wisdom-{name}.md and follow those instructions.' Enter

Key fixes needed in system3-orchestrator SKILL.md:
- Add `exec zsh` before any env var exports
- Add `unset CLAUDECODE` before ccorch
- Use file reference for wisdom injection instead of tmux paste-buffer (markdown breaks paste)
- Document that tmux defaults to bash and ccorch is a zsh function
close_reason: Fixed SKILL.md Option B: added exec zsh (step 4), unset CLAUDECODE (step 5), file reference for wisdom (step 10), increased sleep to 8s, added explanatory comments for all steps

title: PRD-S3-ATTRACTOR-002 Epic 2: Hybrid Channel Bridge (OpenClaw Pattern)
description:
Hybrid Channel Bridge with Adapter Pattern (inspired by OpenClaw's hub-and-spoke gateway).

Architecture:
- ChannelAdapter ABC with InboundMessage/OutboundMessage Pydantic models (from POC)
- PRIMARY: LocalHooksAdapter — wraps existing gchat-send.sh + gchat-poll-replies.py. Works on localhost now.
- OPTIONAL FUTURE: WebhookAdapter — FastAPI on localhost, exposed via Tailscale Funnel (OpenClaw pattern) for real-time GChat webhooks.
- Adapter registry with factory function for dynamic loading

OpenClaw Pattern: Keep engine on localhost, expose ONLY webhook path publicly via Tailscale Funnel / Caddy reverse proxy / Cloudflare Tunnel. Don't deploy whole app to cloud.

Key files:
- channel_adapter.py (exists from POC — enhance)
- adapters/local_hooks_adapter.py (NEW — primary)
- adapters/gchat_adapter.py (enhance from POC)
- channel_intents.py (intent parser: approve/reject/status/help)
- channel_cards.py (card formatting for progress reports)

The runner doesn't care which adapter — it calls adapter.send_outbound() and adapter.parse_inbound().
notes: impl_complete: 108/108 tests passing, all AC-2.x met
close_reason: Epic 2 Channel Bridge: GChat adapter, 108/108 tests. PR #19
